conclusion: Objects A and B are cloth-like sheets suspended above the table.
Because of gravity, each cloth falls vertically until it encounters an obstacle.
On the left side, cloth A drapes over the taller white block C and the slightly taller dark block D.
On the right side, cloth B drapes over the taller orange block E and the slightly shorter brown block F.
Once the cloths settle, friction keeps them in place, conforming around the shapes of the blocks underneath.
As A and B fall, they drape over and conform to the contours of C, D and E, F respectively, coming to rest as table-cloth-like covers around those four upright blocks.
